body.p: THANKS Something nice happened at the court house one day last week. Oliver Ristuben, clerk of circuit court, was given a happy surprise by his fellow workers in the building. They all chipped inas the saying is, and bought a hearing device for him. Everybody in the building was almost as happy about it as he was when it proved to work in his case. Seven- teen years ago, following an illness of a few weeks, he recovered with impaired hearing. It has been a great handicap, as it would to anyone, but he has carried on in spite of it. He asked us to put a small card of thanks in the paper so all who made the gift would know how deeply appreciative he is. We are overstepping in doing it, but hope he will forgive us. A small card of thanks does not ade- quately express the feeling he gave us when he told about it. He said that when he adjusts the machine and cuts through the wall of silence that ; usually surrounds him, the bitterness \ falls away. His friends join in this I thanks to the thought which made the ' gift possible.
